articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: The highlight of Steven McLean’s six-month stint as St Johnstone manager was earning a draw at Celtic Park in August.  His team defended for most of the match but had chances to snatch all three points in the second half. It was a rare positive note for the Perth side before McLean was emptied out [...]
articles.title: No more season highlights for St Johnstone

articles.description: I AM beginning to wonder if Paulo Bernardo is Oliver Abildgaard with a better tan. I hope I am miles off target, but I just can’t see the attraction of Celtic’s on-loan Portuguese midfielder. Yes, I realise there will be many who disagree with me and, yes, I am aware Bernardo and Abildgaard are too [...]

articles.description: ALISTAIR JOHNSTON is hoping St Johnstone feel the force as Celtic attempt to overcome their most recent Champions League disappointment. The Canada World Cup right-back was part of the Hoops defence that folded in the final eight minutes as Lazio struck twice in Rome to send Brendan Rodgers’ side into European oblivion. For the second consecutive [...]

articles.description: MIKEY JOHNSTON has received a blunt message from Brendan Rodgers: Do your talking on the pitch! Johnston, who spent last season on loan at Portuguese top-flight club Vitoria Guimaraes, has yet to start a game [...]

The spot-kick was awarded in the 66th minute of an encounter [...]

articles.description: I read the CQN Magazine article this morning on our December fixtures; eight games, seven in the league, with only one midweek off.  It has the look of a month which will go a long way to deciding the outcome of the title. The awkward looking fixtures come at the start of the month.  Away [...]
